content.text:
# List of international presidential trips made by Zoran Milanović

and Zoran Milanović at Palazzo del Quirinale in 2021]]
of Slovenia.]]
Zoran Milanović has served as the 5th President of Croatia since 19 February 2020. During this time period he has conducted several official, state and working visits to a total of 11 foreign countries.
Countries visited by Zoran Milanović by number of visits as of :
*One visit: Bulgaria, Italy, Germany, Hungary, Kosovo, Chile
*Two visits: Austria (one held, one planned), Montenegro
*Three visits: Slovenia (two held, one planned)
Realized trips
2020
{| class="wikitable"
!Country
!Locations
!Date
!Details
|-
|
|Otočec ob Krki
|27 February
|Met with Slovenian President Borut Pahor.
|-
|
|Vienna and Eisenstadt
|2 March
|Met with Austrian President Alexander Van der Bellen and Burgenland Croats.
|-
|
|Maribor and Ptuj
|15 May
|Visited Dobrava cemetery near Maribor and held a working meeting with Slovenian President Borut Pahor in Ptuj.
|-
|
|Tivat, Cetinje, Podgorica, Donja Lastva and Kotor
|22–23 June
|First international presidential trip in modern Croatia's history on board of a Navy vessel (OOB-31 Omiš). Attended separate meetings with Montenegrin President Milo Đukanović, Prime Minister Duško Marković and Speaker of the Parliament Ivan Brajović. Held meetings with representatives of Croatian business and cultural interest groups in Montenegro.
|-
|
|Brdo pri Kranju
|29 June
|Due to attend a multilateral meeting of heads of state and government from countries participating in the Brdo-Brijuni Process.
|-
|
|Vienna
|7-8 July
|Held a trilateral meeting with the presidents of Austria and Slovenia on the topic of the future of the European Union following the COVID-19 pandemic.
|-
|
|Berlin
|11 September
|Met with President Frank-Walter Steinmeier.
|}
2021
{| class="wikitable"
!Country
!Locations
!Date
!Details
|-
|
|Rome
|October 22
|Met with President Sergio Mattarella.
|-
| colspan="2" |
|November 16
|Met with Pope Francis and visited Pontifical Croatian College of St. Jerome.
|-
|
|Pristina
|December 23-4
|Met with the president, prime minister, parliament speaker; visited Croatian soldiers in KFOR camp on Christmas Eve
|}
2022
{| class="wikitable"
!Country
!Locations
!Date
!Details
|-
|
|Santiago, Valparaíso, Antofagasta, Punta Arenas
|December 8-15
|First state visit after Boric became Chilean president. Met with President Gabriel Boric (of Croatian descent) and exchanged decorations; spoke in a special session of both chambers of Chilean Parliament, visited Croat community in the country, held a lecture at Universidad de Chile and visited European Southern Observatory.
|}
2023
{| class="wikitable"
!Country
!Locations
!Date
!Details
|-
|
|Budapest, Veszprem
|January 20-21
|Met with President Katalin Novak, prime minister Orbán; delivered a speech at the opening ceremony of Veszprem - European Culture Capital 2023.
|-
|
|Cairo, El-Shatt
|February 4-7
|Met with the president, prime minister and parliament speaker; as well as tourism minister and secretary-general of Arab League. Visited Suez Canal and Croatian WW2 refugee camp and cemetery El-Shatt.
|-
|
|Podgorica, Tivat
|May 21
|Took part in the inauguration of president-elect Jakov Milatović in the capital; then visited Croat community in Bay of Kotor (Donja Lastva).
|-
|
|Sofia
|May 25
|Met with President Rumen Radev, prime minister and parliament speaker; delivered a lecture at Sofia University.
|}
Planned trips
{| class="wikitable"
!Country
!Locations
!Date
!Details
|-
|
|Tallinn
|19-20 October 2020
|Due to attend the 5th annual Three Seas Summit and Business Forum.
|}
Cancelled trips
{| class="wikitable"
!Country
!Locations
!Planned date
!Details
|-
|
|Moscow
|24 June 2020
|Milanović was due to attend the 75th anniversary Moscow Victory Day Parade and to hold a bilateral meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin, however, the trip was cancelled due to a malfunction on the government jet and the lack of available commercial flights.
|-
|
|London
|6 May 2023
|Milanović was due to attend the Coronation of Charles III, however, the trip was cancelled due to a malfunction on the [https://vlada.gov.hr/ostalo-14954/ministries-and-government-bodies/government-offices/directorate-for-the-use-of-official-aircrafts-in-croatian-only/airplane-challenger-cl-604/16288 government jet].
|}
See also
*List of state visits made by Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović, President of Croatia (2015–2020)
